member.name: T:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter
member.summary: Contains methods to render a as an SVG file.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.SaveAsSVG(VectSharp.Page,System.String,VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render the page to an SVG file.
member.param: The to render.
The full path to the file to save. If it exists, it will be overwritten.
Defines whether the used fonts should be included in the file.

A dictionary associating element tags to link targets. If this is provided, objects that have been drawn with a tag contained in the dictionary will become hyperlink to the destination specified in the dictionary. If the destination starts with a hash (#), it is interpreted as the tag of another object in the current document; otherwise, it is interpreted as an external URI.
Defines how and whether image filters should be rasterised when rendering the image.
If this is , presentation attributes are set as attributes on SVG elements. If this is , CSS classes are used to set presentation attributes.

member.name: T:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions
member.summary: Defines whether the used fonts should be included in the file.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions.EmbedFonts
member.summary: Embeds the full font files.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions.SubsetFonts
member.summary: Embeds subsetted font files containing only the glyphs for the characters that have been used.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions.ConvertIntoPaths
member.summary: Does not embed any font file and converts all text items into paths.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions.DoNotEmbed
member.summary: Does not embed any font file, but still encodes text items as such.

member.name: T:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption
member.summary: Determines how and whether image filters are rasterised.

member.name: T:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.FilterOperations
member.summary: Defines whether image filters should be rasterised or not.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.FilterOperations.RasteriseAll
member.summary: Image filters will always be rasterised.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.FilterOperations.RasteriseIfNecessary
member.summary: Image filters will only be rasterised if they are not supported natively by the output file format.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.FilterOperations.NeverRasteriseAndIgnore
member.summary: Image filters will never be rasterised; for filters that are not supported, the filter will be ignored.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.FilterOperations.NeverRasteriseAndSkip
member.summary: Image filters will never be rasterised; if an image should be drawn with an unsupported filter, the image will not be drawn at all.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.FilterOperations.IgnoreAll
member.summary: All image filters (supported and unsupported) will be ignored.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.FilterOperations.SkipAll
member.summary: All the images that should be drawn with a filter will be ignored.

member.name: P:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.Operation
member.summary: Defines whether image filters should be rasterised or not.

member.name: P:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.RasterisationResolution
member.summary: The resolution that will be used to rasterise image filters. Depending on the value of , this can either be an absolute resolution (i.e. a size in pixel), or a scale factor that is applied to the image size in graphics units.

member.name: P:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.RasterisationResolutionRelative
member.summary: Determines whether the value of is absolute (i.e. a size in pixel), or relative (i.e. a scale factor that is applied to the image size in graphics units).

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.Default
member.summary: The default options for image filter rasterisation.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.#ctor(VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption.FilterOperations,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new object.
member.param: Defines whether image filters should be rasterised or not.

The resolution that will be used to rasterise image filters. Depending on the value of , this can either be an absolute resolution (i.e. a size in pixel), or a scale factor that is applied to the image size in graphics units.
Determines whether the value of is absolute (i.e. a size in pixel), or relative (i.e. a scale factor that is applied to the image size in graphics units).

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.SaveAsSVG(VectSharp.Page,System.IO.Stream,VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render the page to an SVG stream.
member.param: The to render.
The stream to which the SVG data will be written.
Defines whether the used fonts should be included in the file.

A dictionary associating element tags to link targets. If this is provided, objects that have been drawn with a tag contained in the dictionary will become hyperlink to the destination specified in the dictionary. If the destination starts with a hash (#), it is interpreted as the tag of another object in the current document; otherwise, it is interpreted as an external URI.
Defines how and whether image filters should be rasterised when rendering the image.
If this is , presentation attributes are set as attributes on SVG elements. If this is , CSS classes are used to set presentation attributes.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.SaveAsSVG(VectSharp.Page,VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render the page to an SVG document.
member.param: The to render.
Defines whether the used fonts should be included in the file.

A dictionary associating element tags to link targets. If this is provided, objects that have been drawn with a tag contained in the dictionary will become hyperlink to the destination specified in the dictionary. If the destination starts with a hash (#), it is interpreted as the tag of another object in the current document; otherwise, it is interpreted as an external URI.
Defines how and whether image filters should be rasterised when rendering the image.
If this is , presentation attributes are set as attributes on SVG elements. If this is , CSS classes are used to set presentation attributes.
member.returns: An containing the rendered SVG image.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedSVG(VectSharp.Animation,System.Boolean,System.Double,VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption)
member.summary: Render the animation to an SVG document, using SVG animations.
member.param: The to render.
If this is , the generated SVG file will contain playback controls that use Javascript to play/pause the animation and change the current time.

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
Defines whether the used fonts should be included in the file.

A dictionary associating element tags to link targets. If this is provided, objects that have been drawn with a tag contained in the dictionary will become hyperlink to the destination specified in the dictionary. If the destination starts with a hash (#), it is interpreted as the tag of another object in the current document; otherwise, it is interpreted as an external URI.
Defines how and whether image filters should be rasterised when rendering the image.
member.returns: An containing the animated SVG image.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedSVG(VectSharp.Animation,System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Double,VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption)
member.summary: Render the animation to an SVG stream, using SVG animations.
member.param: The to render.
The on which the SVG document will be written.
If this is , the generated SVG file will contain playback controls that use Javascript to play/pause the animation and change the current time.

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
Defines whether the used fonts should be included in the file.

A dictionary associating element tags to link targets. If this is provided, objects that have been drawn with a tag contained in the dictionary will become hyperlink to the destination specified in the dictionary. If the destination starts with a hash (#), it is interpreted as the tag of another object in the current document; otherwise, it is interpreted as an external URI.
Defines how and whether image filters should be rasterised when rendering the image.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedSVG(VectSharp.Animation,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Double,VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption)
member.summary: Render the animation to an SVG file, using SVG animations.
member.param: The to render.
The output file that will be created.
If this is , the generated SVG file will contain playback controls that use Javascript to play/pause the animation and change the current time.

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
Defines whether the used fonts should be included in the file.

A dictionary associating element tags to link targets. If this is provided, objects that have been drawn with a tag contained in the dictionary will become hyperlink to the destination specified in the dictionary. If the destination starts with a hash (#), it is interpreted as the tag of another object in the current document; otherwise, it is interpreted as an external URI.
Defines how and whether image filters should be rasterised when rendering the image.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.SaveAsAnimatedSVGWithFrames(VectSharp.Animation,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.TextOptions,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},VectSharp.SVG.SVGContextInterpreter.FilterOption)
member.summary: Render the animation to an SVG document, encoding discrete frames.
member.param: The to render.
If this is , the generated SVG file will contain playback controls that use Javascript to play/pause the animation and change the current time.
The target frame rate of the animation, in frames-per-second (fps).

A scaling factor that will be applied to all durations in the animation. Values greater than 1 slow down the animation, values smaller than 1 accelerate it. Note that this does not affect the frame rate of the animation.
Defines whether the used fonts should be included in the file.

A dictionary associating element tags to link targets. If this is provided, objects that have been drawn with a tag contained in the dictionary will become hyperlink to the destination specified in the dictionary. If the destination starts with a hash (#), it is interpreted as the tag of another object in the current document; otherwise, it is interpreted as an external URI.
Defines how and whether image filters should be rasterised when rendering the image.
member.returns: An containing the animated SVG image.

member.name: T:VectSharp.SVG.Parser
member.summary: Contains methods to read an SVG image file.

member.name: F:VectSharp.SVG.Parser.ParseImageURI
member.summary: A function that takes as input an image URI and a boolean value indicating whether the image should be interpolated, and returns a object containing the image. By default, this is equal to , i.e. it is only able to parse SVG images. If you wish to enable the parsing of other formats, you should install the "VectSharp.MuPDFUtils" NuGet package and enable the parser in your program by doing something like: VectSharp.SVG.Parser.ParseImageURI = VectSharp.MuPDFUtils.ImageURIParser.Parser(VectSharp.SVG.Parser.ParseSVGURI);

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.Parser.ParseSVGURI(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses an SVG image URI.
member.param: The image URI to parse.
This value is ignored and is only needed for compatibility.
member.returns: A containing the parsed SVG image, or null.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.Parser.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Parses SVG source into a containing the image represented by the code.
member.param: The SVG source code.
member.returns: A containing the image represented by the .

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.Parser.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Parses an SVG image file into a containing the image.
member.param: The path to the SVG image file.
member.returns: A containing the image represented by the file.

member.name: M:VectSharp.SVG.Parser.FromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Parses an stream containing SVG source code into a containing the image represented by the code.
member.param: The stream containing SVG source code.
member.returns: A containing the image represented by the .
